channel.title: I cant handle this anymore!
channel.description: ok for the last week ive been repeatedly getting SYI'd. i am so FUCKING TIRED OF IT! i cant even get 2 people on before he floods again! im getting crashed at least 50 times a day. can someone PLEASE tell me how to stop it?

I thought you were a good coder?

I thought you were gay…

Rayne, Stop. That doesn’t work, the adress of his attacker is different, and probably uses a proxy.

–
Vato, Message me on MSN.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 30, 2008, 05:07:36 PM[/size][hr]And they create nulls, That’s why.

Read full topic

@Rayne wrote:

but thats only 1 person…

Credit to xx qwertyuiop xx

if (found < 3)

and change it to
Code:

if (found < 3 && !connectingHost.startsWith("user-0c6s0lh.cable.mindspring.com"))

that will cause your server to ignore connections from his ip.

change the ip, the same person is probably doing it.

item.title: I cant handle this anymore!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

java got me compiled:

make it 1 login per ip…

Its not the fact that they’re all loging in at once, im guessing he has some code to block SYI, but hes still getting lag from them attempting to log in, his runserver would be packed with “name - disconnected, error writing file, packet dropped” etc.

Am i right? o_O

item.title: I cant handle this anymore!
item.dc:creator: @vato vato
item.description:
@vato wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:8, topic:216472”][quote author=cocoa link=topic=284519.msg2306388#msg2306388 date=1214866820]
well

how about you make it so anyone’s name with SYIpkpker can’t log in to your server
[/quote]
Because it doesn’t matter. My server is probably the only WinterLove based server (which is crap) that doesn’t crash from SYI. Heres my solution (no code given):

  1. Each login has a timeout, so after lets say 5 or 10 seconds the login fails and the client is -really- disconnected and the object is completely destroyed for the garbage collector to eat.
  2. There is some name detected to speed up the time outs with certain names. So a name containing SYIpkpker would timeout immediately, and the IP is added to the ‘too many connections’ list until there is no activity from it for ~10 seconds.
  3. Using the ‘too many connections from your address’. This message is in the client for a reason, to be used. It doesn’t matter if the logins are successful or not, after ~5 connections from an IP in ~10 seconds the IP is added to the ‘too many connections’ list until 10 seconds with no connections from that IP.

And that solves the problem. The timeout is the key part, along with the ‘too many connections’ list. Test your server with my bot at http://www.allgofree.org/blitzbot/ and make sure to check the null checkbox.[/quote]

i used your allgofree bot, but it laggs me. i use the crasher given to me by MrMoney and the SYI’s i got

Anyways i know who’s doing it know.
the attacks coming from godasgard.no-ip.info
what would happen if i DoS’d it on port 80?

Read full topic

item.title: I cant handle this anymore!
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:6, topic:216472”]well

how about you make it so anyone’s name with SYIpkpker can’t log in to your server[/quote]
Because it doesn’t matter. My server is probably the only WinterLove based server (which is crap) that doesn’t crash from SYI. Heres my solution (no code given):

  1. Each login has a timeout, so after lets say 5 or 10 seconds the login fails and the client is -really- disconnected and the object is completely destroyed for the garbage collector to eat.
  2. There is some name detected to speed up the time outs with certain names. So a name containing SYIpkpker would timeout immediately, and the IP is added to the ‘too many connections’ list until there is no activity from it for ~10 seconds.
  3. Using the ‘too many connections from your address’. This message is in the client for a reason, to be used. It doesn’t matter if the logins are successful or not, after ~5 connections from an IP in ~10 seconds the IP is added to the ‘too many connections’ list until 10 seconds with no connections from that IP.

And that solves the problem. The timeout is the key part, along with the ‘too many connections’ list. Test your server with my bot at http://www.allgofree.org/blitzbot/ and make sure to check the null checkbox.

Read full topic
